messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Kaze Hikaru released by Viz
messages.msgSnippet: ... I d have to agree with you-- I haven t been able to spot any glaring anachronisms as yet. She s really good at what she does, and I hope she keeps going
messages.messageBody:
>Kaze Hikaru is a wonderfully told story, it's soooo
>good with the history that you've really got to hand
>it to "Maruko-sensei" (Watanabe Taeko's nickname) for
>doing her research.

I'd have to agree with you-- I haven't been able to spot any glaring
anachronisms as yet. She's really good at what she does, and I hope she
keeps going with it!

-M.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Kaze Hikaru released by Viz
messages.msgSnippet: Kaze Hikaru is a wonderfully told story, it s soooo good with the history that you ve really got to hand it to Maruko-sensei (Watanabe Taeko s nickname) for
messages.messageBody:
Kaze Hikaru is a wonderfully told story, it's soooo
good with the history that you've really got to hand
it to "Maruko-sensei" (Watanabe Taeko's nickname) for
doing her research. Then again, I have the added
advantage of being Japanese.

And I LOVE Saitou in it too!

--- Karen Peck <kypeck@...> 說：


---------------------------------
<<<Warning: Kaze Hikaru spoilers>>>









As I understand from summaries and the KH mailing
list, the little girl,
Yuki, is NOT Okita's daughter. She is the child of
Kohana, a geisha
that Okita knows. Yuki's father is a samurai and
would not/could not
marry Kohana because of her status. Yuki actually
thinks of Okita as
her father as he helps take care of her and her
mother.

Viz has been doing a good job oh KH so far in Shojo
Beat - the first
four chapters were preceded by articles outlining the
history of the
Shinsengumi and of Japan during the period; and it
even made the cover
of the November issue with an interview with the
Watanabe Taeko and a
"get this look" article, which even outlined how to
make an
approximation of a traditional women's hairstyle! I
can't speak much to
the accuracy of the translation, however, but it seems
in line with
other translations I have seen.

The first collected volume should be out around New
Years with the first
five chapters, it will retail for $8.99 in the US.

Viz's site on KH: http://shojobeat.com/manga/kh/

-SafetyGirl

messages.subject: RE: [SHQ] Kaze Hikaru released by Viz
messages.msgSnippet: As I understand from summaries and the KH mailing list, the little girl, Yuki, is NOT Okita s daughter.  She is the child
messages.messageBody:
<<<Warning: Kaze Hikaru spoilers>>>









As I understand from summaries and the KH mailing list, the little girl,
Yuki, is NOT Okita's daughter. She is the child of Kohana, a geisha
that Okita knows. Yuki's father is a samurai and would not/could not
marry Kohana because of her status. Yuki actually thinks of Okita as
her father as he helps take care of her and her mother.

Viz has been doing a good job oh KH so far in Shojo Beat - the first
four chapters were preceded by articles outlining the history of the
Shinsengumi and of Japan during the period; and it even made the cover
of the November issue with an interview with the Watanabe Taeko and a
"get this look" article, which even outlined how to make an
approximation of a traditional women's hairstyle! I can't speak much to
the accuracy of the translation, however, but it seems in line with
other translations I have seen.

The first collected volume should be out around New Years with the first
five chapters, it will retail for $8.99 in the US.

Viz's site on KH: http://shojobeat.com/manga/kh/

-SafetyGirl

and
a little girl (Oyuki), who, if I'm not mistaken, is Okita's daughter...

-M.

messages.msgSnippet: Awesome! I ve been keeping up with the newest volumes here in Japan...it s gonna be a GREAT series. The volume I got features Itou, Hanaka-dayuu, the usual
messages.messageBody:
Awesome! I've been keeping up with the newest volumes here in Japan...it's
gonna be a GREAT series. The volume I got features Itou, Hanaka-dayuu, the
usual guys (Kondou/Hijikata/Okita), of course, Sei, Matsudaira Katamori, and
a little girl (Oyuki), who, if I'm not mistaken, is Okita's daughter...

-M.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Kaze Hikaru released by Viz
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know if this has been posted yet, but Viz will be releasing volume 1 of Kaze Hikaru next year in January. News here.
messages.messageBody:
I don't know if this has been posted yet, but Viz will be releasing volume 1 of Kaze Hikaru next year in January. News here.

http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/article.php?id=7086

Recently, they've also already started releasing chapters in their monthy Shoujo Beat magazines.

~Okita
